## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 652098641.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz -int 187465780 187465780 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 699 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 14 individuals
 --read 1667 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 434 individuals
 --read 4717 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 3108 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1667 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1609 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --753 type 2 SNPs
 --30 type 3 SNPs
 --783 total SNPs

 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --855 type 2 SNPs

 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1668 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1608 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 434 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 14 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [187465780,187465780]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)

   HMM states for imputation: 250 [Panel 1->2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1650361577.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz -int 5030822 5030822 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output_warnings

--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 274042994.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz -int 59257464 59257464 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output_warnings

-----------------

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 561399495.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz -int 85189259 85189259 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 764 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 14 individuals
 --read 2362 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 431 individuals
 --read 7140 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 4885 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2362 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2255 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1817679103.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz -int 28021157 28021157 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output_warnings

--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 2034211734.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz -int 162546619 162546619 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 --read 726 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 80 individuals
 --read 3078 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1055 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2210 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2023 SNPs with data in multiple panels

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 66577805.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz -int 63769835 63769835 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 422 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 14 individuals
 --read 981 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 433 individuals
 --read 3908 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2974 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 981 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 934 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs

 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 982 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 933 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 433 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 14 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [63769835,63769835]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10

diploid sampling success rate: 0.996

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

 IMPUTE version 2.3.2

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 287832554.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/input.gen.gz -int 94741246 94741246 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output_summary

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 240332997.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz -int 70429927 70429927 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output_warnings

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1708476263.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/input.gen.gz -int 115874566 115874566 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 802 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 14 individuals
 --read 1590 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 431 individuals
 --read 4514 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2983 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1590 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1531 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 702849095.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/input.gen.gz -int 107730976 107730976 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0097/output_warnings

--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 598451020.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/input.gen.gz -int 40236043 40236043 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0102/output_warnings

-----------------

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1945688705.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/input.gen.gz -int 105329107 105329107 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 819 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 14 individuals
 --read 2175 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0113/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 96 individuals
 --read 3877 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1836 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2175 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2041 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 2176 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 2040 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters

        reference diplotypes: 96 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 14 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [105329107,105329107]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 812992226.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0141/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0141/input.gen.gz -int 180412336 180412336 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0141/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0141/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0141/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0141/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0141/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0141/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0141/output_summary

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 709610544.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/input.gen.gz -int 123479639 123479639 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0156/output_warnings

-----------------

 --read 757 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --read 3430 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1425 SNPs in Panel 2

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1256 SNPs with data in multiple panels

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 23559258.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/input.gen.gz -int 44059478 44059478 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 417 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 14 individuals
 --read 989 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0174/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 92 individuals
 --read 2145 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1308 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 989 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 837 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

        reference diplotypes: 92 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 14 [Panel 2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!
